title: Particle diagram of H2O2 MnO4- titration - halfway

content.question: A particle view of a sample of H2O2(aq) is shown above. The H2O2(aq) is titrated with KMnO4(aq), as represented by the equation below. 2 MnO4−(aq) + 5 H2O2(aq) + 6 H+(aq) → 2 Mn2+(aq) + 5 O2(g) + 8 H2O(l) Which of the following particle views best represents the mixture when the titration is halfway to the equivalence point? (H2O molecules and H+ ions are not shown.)

choices.label: There are 10 circles. There are 6 larger circles labeled H 2 O 2 and 4 slightly smaller circles labeled M n with a positive 2 charge.
There are 10 circles. There are 3 large circles labeled M n O 4 with a negative one charge, 4 slightly smaller circles labeled H 2 O 2, and 3 smaller circles labeled M n with a positive 2 charge.
There are 7 circles. There are 5 larger circles labeled H 2 O 2 and there are 2 slightly smaller circles labeled M n with a positive 2 charge.

There are 7 circles. There is 1 large circle labeled M n O 4 with a negative one charge, 5 slightly smaller circles labeled H 2 O 2, and 1 slightly smaller circle labeled M n with a positive 2 charge.

content.answer: There are 7 circles. There are 5 larger circles labeled H 2 O 2 and there are 2 slightly smaller circles labeled M n with a positive 2 charge.

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
